Headline: Why Airbnb Can Actually Benefit From Higher Interest Rates, source:Yahoo, summary: There are plenty of reasons to invest in Airbnb (NASDAQ: ABNB).  When you make a booking on Airbnb, the company keeps that money until you arrive at your stay (and only then passing on the amount due to the host), and it earns interest on this money in the interim period by investing it in money-market funds and short-term, high-quality bonds. Headline: EU court rules Airbnb must provide rental info to tax authorities, withhold tax, source:Yahoo, summary: Short-term accommodation services company Airbnb must provide information in rental contracts to tax authorities and withhold tax under a national tax regime, the European Union's top court ruled on Thursday.  The ruling comes in response to a challenge from Airbnb to an Italian law from 2017 requiring Airbnb and other short-term rental sites to forward information from their rental contracts to tax authorities and to withhold 21% from the rental income and pay it to tax authorities. Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia sees so much potential growth in ADUs that he started a new company, Samara, to help homeowners build these second dwellings. For more of Yahoo Finance's special coverage on Real Estate: The New Reality, click here., Headline: Real estate roundup: Barbara Corcoran, Joe Gebbia, and more, source:Yahoo, summary: Looking for the latest news on the housing market, home renovations, and real estate investing? Yahoo Finance is here to help. We spoke to experts across the industry, exploring real estate trends, tips for first-time home buying, mortgage rates and more. Shark Tank star and The Corcoran Group Founder Barbara Corcoran thinks that now is the absolute best time to buy a home. Corcoran says that if you wait "everybody will come charging the market and you'll be paying another 10% for the house." Some developers are beginning to turn office buildings into residential buildings. Yahoo Finance's Dani Romero spoke with Joey Chilelli of the Vanbarton Group, which is turning a New York City office building into apartments. Chilelli is hoping to "create a vibrant environment for new residents." Chris Porter, John Burns Research & Consulting Senior Vice President and Chief Demographer, thinks that elevated mortgage rates may be keeping homebuyers out of the housing market. Porter says, "It's given some more market share to the home builders. The new construction has really been able to step in ... and that's why you see the builders doing quite well right now." The sale of luxury homes in the city of Los Angeles is starting to show some signs of recovery. Josh Altman, Co-founder of The Altman Brothers, says there is "good competition in the lower price points, which in LA of course are that $1-2 million range." Zillow Chief Economist Skylar Olsen breaks down inflation in rent prices, which may be putting many households at risk of falling into financial instability. Olsen says, "This is a massive generation of millennials that are putting pressure on the market." The popularity of accessory dwelling units, or ADUs, has soared, particularly in the state of California. Yahoo Finance's Akiko Fujita provided a report live from California, and also spoke to Airbnb (ABNB) Co-founder Joe Gebbia. Gebbia started a new company, Samara, to help homeowners build these second dwellings. Gebbia says, "It's kind of a no brainer of a way to make some extra income." For more of our special coverage on Real Estate: The New Reality, click here.
